intro: Mesembryanthemum bosscheanum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its fleshy leaves and drought tolerance make it an attractive choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
